content: Hi! I installed lean using the instructions on the Arch Linux wiki after which I installed the lean4 plugin for vscode (the OSS version, so the plugin is from Open VSX). It happily evaluates #eval Lean.versionString to the version I installed (nightly-2023-06-20). However, when I start a project using $(elan which lake) new ..., vscode can't create a connection to the language server, saying Launching server using command lake failed. Error: spawn lake ENOENT. Note that lake is not a command on my machine, I have to use $(elan which lake). Thanks in advance!
That's a packaging bug, see https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113489-new-members/topic/.E2.9C.94.20Unable.20to.20import.20subpackages.20of.20Mathlib for a longer discussion
You can install elan manually or edit the PKGBUILD as described in the linked thread
I see, should've read the comments. Fixing the PKGBUILD worked, thanks!
Wessel de Weijer has marked this topic as resolved.
